speaker: Morty
dialogue: Hey Rick, how did Newton, you know, discover gravity?

speaker: Rick
dialogue: Oh Morty, Newton did not 'discover' gravity. Gravity was around long before he smartened up.

speaker: Morty
dialogue: What do you mean? I thought an apple fell on his head or something.

speaker: Rick
dialogue: Sure, the apple thing is a cute story, Morty. But really, Newton was just sitting around one day, thinking about why stuff falls down instead of up.

speaker: Morty
dialogue: So, was he the first one to think of that?

speaker: Rick
dialogue: Many people noticed stuff falls, Morty. But Newton asked the right questions and wrote down the math.

speaker: Morty
dialogue: So he was like, the first guy to put it all together?

speaker: Rick
dialogue: Exactly, Morty. He formulated how it works, with equations, gave it some Newtonian branding, and boom, scientific fame.

speaker: Morty
dialogue: So it is not like he invented it, just explained it?

speaker: Rick
dialogue: Pretty much, Morty. Gravity got a PR boost, thanks to Newton. That is all there is to it.
